page.title: 01Area along A580 N.of Worsley
page.content: {Location}-area covered is North of the A580 from Mosley Common in West to Wardley Wood in East.This includes the motorway intersection M61-62,A580 and the district of Ellenbrook. {History}-much of the area in the past was associated with farming.As coal was discovered small independent shafts were sunk,later joining to form Mosley Common Colliery in the West. {Transport}-the railway line(dismantled in 1966)from Wigan to M'cr ran North of the main colliery site.The East Lancs Rd.(A580)opened in 1936 provides access to Manchester and Liverpool. This links with the M62 East and M61 South. {Residential}-housing in the area is divided into 2 main blocks constructed chiefly during the last 30 years. Property is owner-occupied & leasehold mainly from Bridgewater Estate.
